NSHR.text: Loggerhead Shrikes are a bit smaller than Northern Shrikes.
The Loggerhead Shrike's breast is pure white, or only very faintly barred. If the barring is at all apparent it's a Northern Shrike.
The black mask on the Loggerhead Shrike is thicker and more extensive than it is with Northern Shrikes. The mask wraps across the top of the bill.
Loggerheads often have a stubbier bill with a smaller hook than Northerns.
